intro: Hieracium strictiflorum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium strictiflorum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
